instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Still bad CPU on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ?
threads.message:
Hello,

For this board, I saw 8.5 OHM on <SIGNAL>PP1V_S5G</SIGNAL>.
On a functional card I measure 1.09k OHM

I think CPU dead, I injected 1V on <SIGNAL>PP1V_S5G</SIGNAL> (I don't know if this is the right thing to do) and the CPU barely heats up.

Confirm if you have another idea or if the board is for the trash?

Thanks in advance for yours reply :)

threads.title: Still bad CPU on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ?
threads.message:
Is  <SIGNAL>PP1V_S5G</SIGNAL>  the only power rail where you've found lower resistance than normal?
Check all coils around CPU and <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and compare with good board.
Also check all output rails from page 64.
